climbs.name: Summer Solstice
climbs.fa: Harrison Holthouse, Matt Bogar, Jay Foley. June 21, 2012

content.description:
Thin, technical crimping up to and past the 2nd bolt. Easier climbing from the third bolt to the anchors.  

  Note: I couldn't find any beta on the route name, so if you know what it is, feel free to post up!
content.location: The 3rd route from the left on Tim's Thumb. Just left of "Father's Day".

climbs.name: It Takes a Village to Raise a Route
climbs.fa: Gina Hawryluk, Scott Resnick and Dan Greenwald

content.description:
Fun, sustained face climbing on good pockets and edges. 

  Thin, technical crimping up to and past the 2nd bolt. Easier climbing from the third bolt to the anchors.
content.location: The second route from the left on Tim's Thumb.

content.description:
Excellent climbing on really cool, water-polished features. Neat laybacks to a thin, well-protected crux at the fourth bolt. 

  Top rope variation (directly under the anchors): The Middle Child, 10a
content.location: The furthest left route on Tim's Thumb.

content.description:
Fun sequential climbing on small crimps leads to a distinct crux move at the 3rd clip. Fight the pump and catch a well-deserved rest at the 4th bolt, with mellower climbing to the anchors.  

  I felt that the crux sequence of this climb was as difficult as any of the moves on the neighboring "Family Man", but the route is not quite as sustained.
content.location: On Tim's Thumb, immediately left of "Family Day". Finishes just to the left of the obvious black arete in the middle of the wall.

climbs.name: Family Man
climbs.fa: Tim Naylor, J Foley, Donna & Milan

content.description: Currently the hardest route in Comales Canyon. Steep line with continuous hard moves to a rest midway then easier climbing above. Climbs steep orange face behind big tree to black arete above.
content.location: This route is located on independent formation "Tim's Thumb" a small cliff with pointy summit partially visible from and left of Fire Wall about 30 meters. Walk Left from Fire Wall past first wall with roof routes.

content.description: Bouldery crux pulling the roof at the second bolt to easier climbing above. Maybe the "least-good" of the the climbs on the formation, but still worth doing.
content.location: The furthest right route on Tim's Thumb. Just right of the classic "Family Man", which starts by the big tree and climbs through a series of roofs to a black arete.

content.description: Short and small formation with 6 sport routes and one TR. A large tree provides afternoon shade for Father's Day and Family Man.
